headline: Ohio GOP Primary Debate Almost Turns Into A Fist Fight As Candidates Go Off The Rails [VIDEO]
author: Red Voice Media

Candidate Senate forum in Ohio got tense a Fridays candidates Mike Gibbons and Josh Mandel got into a face-off that almost ended in a physical altercation.

The argument escalated when Mandel claimed that Gibbons had made millions from business dealings with Chinese companies.
Gibbons and Mandel are two of the seven potential candidates for the Republican primary that is set for May 3.
The Mandel campaign could not be reached for a comment regarding the altercation.
Eventually, the altercation came to an end without any punches being thrown.
